description:
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

As a Policy Specialist for YouTube Monetization, you are passionate about making sure that YouTube is a safe platform for advertisers, creators, and users. You will assist with the implementation and enforcement of YouTube's monetization policies with a special focus to identify and action on abuse trends. You'll be responsible for ensuring the quality of YouTube’s monetizable video inventory that is at the core of generating revenue from a broad range of new YouTube advertising products and content partner programs. You'll serve as the policy expert on cross-functional teams with Product and engineering and working with partner teams on policy consultations.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 2 years of relevant experience in an analytically-intensive role, such as business intelligence, corporate strategy, or quantitative research.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience content and ads policies in the internet industry.
  • Policy experience, with robust knowledge of the technology sector and the key policy issues affecting the internet like advertising, free expression, and online safety.
  • Technical experience in machine-learning methodology (e.g., understanding of product development flow, ability to translate technical concepts into non-technical terms).
  • Experience using data and technology to solve complex business problems, coupled with the ability to exercise judgment even in a crisis.
  • Effective communication skills with the ability to translate complex issues into simple and clear language.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills and impeccable business judgment, with professional distinction in thought leadership and innovation.
responsibilities:
• Enforce policy decisions for YouTube’s advertiser friendly guidelines. Review controversial and sometimes offensive video content to determine whether or not they’re brand safe.
  • Handle escalations with a fast turn-around time to define and deliver the best action plan.
  • Research and stay up to date on key trends and suspicious patterns in your policy area
  • Increase efficiency through automation, workflow streamlining, and system optimization.
  • Work directly with cross-functional stakeholders to directly convey policy decisions to advertisers and users.
title: Monetization Policy Specialist, YouTube
